instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message: No, that is very clearly GPU or VRAM. What exact type is this?

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message:
Ugh, 216-0729051 chip. There are MANY remarked fake chips around. I have had good results with these 2015 chips:

[url]http://www.ebay.com/itm/New-Arrival-15-ATI-216-0729051-HD4670-Laptop-GPU-Graphic-BGA-Chipset-DC-2015-/331955912831[/url]

But you never know what they will send :(

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message:
Golden chipset. Got many chips from them and all works perfectly. Great chips yes.
How do you know it is 9051? Everymac tells you it is HD 4670 and you know it is = 216-0729051?

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message: Had some of these turn up today. Wasnt the 2015 chips in the advert, but some re-balled junk from 2009. Now got to open a case. Pisses me right off.

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message: I know what chip it is because I have replaced dozens...... So I also know how often you get fake shit from China.

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message: How do you tell which are fake once you receive them?

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message: Obviously you can see if it has been reballed and is instant trash. If the chip is new but remarked you can only find out by trying it.

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message:
How do you know it is reballed? Checking the balls?
If I upload a picture, can you check?

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message:
Looks like this.
[ATTACH alt="Click image for larger version  Name:	<SIGNAL>IMG_20160212_160608325_HDR</SIGNAL>.jpg Views:	1 Size:	29.5 KB ID:	11326" type="full" width="433px"]11326._xfImport[/ATTACH]

threads.title: Is that bad screen imac?
threads.message:
You can just tell by looking at the chip under a scope. There will be scratches on the die, also you can often see wicking marks between solder balls. 

One give away is the advert will say +2015 manufactured date. Then the chip you get is from 2009 or 2010. These are all tell tale signs.
